definition: cigarette or pipe tobacco/CL:根[gen1]/smoke/mist/vapour/CL:縷|缕[lu:3]/tobacco plant/(of the eyes) to be irritated by smoke
fire/urgent/ammunition/fiery or flaming/internal heat (Chinese medicine)/hot (popular)/classifier for military units (old)/Kangxi radical 86
to restrain/to dam a stream and change its direction/a mound
Yantai prefecture level city in Shandong

sentences.english: It soon turned into black smog as the smoke of the city poured into the air.
sentences.chinese: 隨着城市的煙排入天空，白霧很快變成了黑色煙霧。

sentences.english: The montgolfier brothers began experimenting by filling small paper bags with smoke.
sentences.chinese: 蒙戈爾菲耶兄弟倆最初的實驗是把煙裝進小紙袋。

sentences.english: The smoke is stinging my eyes.
sentences.chinese: 煙把我的眼睛薰得很疼。

sentences.english: He took a deep draw on his pipe and tried again.
sentences.chinese: 他猛吸了一口煙，又試了起來。

sentences.english: We had to stuff the ventilator shafts up to stop the smoke entering the room.
sentences.chinese: 爲了阻止煙進入室內，我們只好把通風道堵起來。

sentences.english: Does the YSR E-Cigarette have a smell?
sentences.chinese: 使用依思瑞電子煙，是否會有難聞的味道？

sentences.english: He had smoked for so many years that his teeth were permanently stained yellow.
sentences.chinese: 他吸了那麼多年煙，牙齒都被永久地薰黃了。

sentences.english: He watched it drift through the pine tops.
sentences.chinese: 他望着這縷煙盤繞在樹尖。

sentences.english: Bouquet: Excellent concentration. Berry nose with vanilla flavours and complex oakiness.
sentences.chinese: 濃醇度，芳香帶濃厚果味，有香料和煙的香氣。

sentences.english: Smoke from the camp-fires spiraled up into a clear sky.
sentences.chinese: 營火冒出的煙嫋嫋升上明淨的天空。

sentences.english: This new age mobile application Egg Timer will keep you roast tender and the smoke away.
sentences.chinese: 這個新時代的移動應用煮蛋計時器將讓您烤嫩和煙了。

sentences.english: Your fingers are brown. You've been smoking too much.
sentences.chinese: 你手指都黃了，你煙抽得太多了。

sentences.english: Glutinous rice and then funnel flat little dumplings are deflated too much smoke there.
sentences.chinese: 糯米飯然後漏斗平，小餃子是癟的，有太多的煙。

sentences.english: Nothing about him gave any suggestion of a child lost in the middle of the desert, a thousand miles from any human habitation.
sentences.chinese: 他絲毫不象是一個迷失在曠無人煙的大沙漠中的孩子。

sentences.english: Smoke while lying down, let the smoke drifts away naturally.
sentences.chinese: 躺着抽菸，讓煙自然飄走。

sentences.english: As soon as he saw me, he took one hard draw on the cigarette and flicked it away.
sentences.chinese: 他看到我，就猛吸了最後一口煙，甩掉菸頭。

definition: to destroy/to spoil/to ruin/to injure/cruel/oppressive/savage/brutal/incomplete/disabled/to remain/to survive/remnant/surplus
bird/CL:隻|只[zhi1],群[qun2]/(dialect) to pay attention to/(intensifier) damned/goddam
